news-item.title: Sawmill Operators Pleads Not Guilty To Accepting Bribe
news-item.text: Here is the text of news released by official news agency Bernama on its website:A sawmill operator pleaded not guilty in the Sessions Court here today to a charge of accepting a RM100,000 bribe, a gratification for helping to obtain a logging permit for a company in 2010. Mohamad Fadzil Mohamad Rathi, 50, was charged with committing the offence at the Welly Timber Industries Sdn Bhd, Plot A26, Lorong Bakau, Kawasan Perusahaan Perabot Sungai Baong, in Seberang Perai Selatan (SPS) on Nov 4, 2010. He was accused of receiving the bribe, which was in cheque form, on behalf of the Perak Forestry Department director, Datuk Nik Muhammad Shah Nik Mustafa, as gratification for helping Intisinar Sdn Bhd, owned by one Abd Rahman Ahmad, to obtain a permit to carry out logging activities in an area in Slim River, Perak. The charge, under Section 16 (a)(B) of the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission Act 2009, carries a maximum imprisonment for 20 years and fine not less than five times the amount of bribe involved. Judge Julie Lack allowed Mohamad Fadzil to be released on bail of RM12,000 in one surety and set April 14 for mention. Prosecution was conducted by deputy public prosecutor from the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Agency, Ahmad Ghazali Mohammad Nadzri.
